text: The August 2020 Midwest derecho was a strong derecho in the Midwestern United Statesâ€“mostly Nebraska, Illinois, Iowa, Wisconsin and Indiana. Nebraska and Iowa were already having severe droughts at the time. The derecho caused large hail, heavy rain and tornadoes. The greatest damage happened in northern Illinois and eastern Iowa. The strongest winds took place in Iowa. They were at 126 miles per hour. Many tornadoes hit northern Illinois. Cedar Rapids, Iowa was severely damaged by the storm. The derecho caused more than $11 billion in damage. ==References== Category:Tornadoes in the United States Category:Tornado outbreaks Category:Derechos Category:2020 in weather Category:2020s in Nebraska Category:2020 in Iowa Category:2020 in Illinois Category:2020s in Indiana Category:2020 in Michigan Category:2020 in Wisconsin Category:2020 disasters in the United States Category:August 2020 events
title: August 2020 Midwest derecho
